Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
  Matrix

public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object

this class represents a two dimensional array that has the int numbers in the range 0-255 while 0 is white and 255 is black. the Matrix represents an black-white picture.

Version:
9.5.2015
Author:
Tomer Paz

Constructor Summary
Matrix(int[][] array)
          contructs a Matrix from a two dimensional array; the dimesion as well as the values of this Matrix will be the same as the dimesions and values of the two-dimesional array.
Matrix(int size1, int size2)
          constructs a size1 by size2 Matrix of zeros.
 
Method Summary

Constructor Detail

Matrix

public Matrix(int[][] array)
contructs a Matrix from a two dimensional array; the dimesion as well as the values of this Matrix will be the same as the dimesions and values of the two-dimesional array.

Parameters:
array - the Matrix's array will be the same as "array" given.

Matrix

public Matrix(int size1,
              int size2)
constructs a size1 by size2 Matrix of zeros.

Parameters:
size1 - the number of rows of the array.
size2 - the number of columns of the array.
Method Detail

imageFilterAverage

public Matrix imageFilterAverage()
returns the picture that gets from "smoothing the picture" every cell becomes the average of it with his neighbors.

Returns:
the Matrix after the "smoothing".

makeNegative

public Matrix makeNegative()
returns the negative image of the picture.(every white cell become black and the opposite.) all the grey shades will be the negative two.

Returns:
the negative Matrix array.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
return a string represting the 2d array
